Firewall_.index_12_: If the firewall is disabled, the server loses security protection. Do you want to continue?
Firewall_.index_14_: The server may be found by hacker after unblocking ICMP, are you sure to unblock ICMP?
Firewall_.index_16_: After Web logs are cleared, website access data is deleted. This operation is irreversible. Determine whether to continue?
Firewall_.index_19_: You are advised to enable the firewall function. After the firewall function is enabled, the current server security can be better protected. Do you want to continue?
Firewall_.index_20_: Blocking ICMP will NOT affect site access, but ICMP function cannot be used for this server, are you sure to block ICMP？

Port_.index_12_: Data port of FTP active mode
Port_.index_14_: Port range of FTP passive mode
Port_.index_30_: After the port policy is set to Permit, access to the port is restored. Do you want to continue?
Port_.index_32_: Do you want to delete the current rule and continue?
Port_.index_35_: Batch delete of selected ports, Continue?
Port_.index_41_: If the port policy is set to Deny, the port will deny external access. Do you want to continue?
Port_.form_6_: Please enter the specified IP, Multiple IPs should be separated by "," or line breaks. e.g. 192.168.1.1, 192.168.1.2
Port_.form_8_: Please enter the specified domain. e.g. www.aapanel.com
Port_.form_15_: The port format is wrong, please fill in the number between 1 and 65535.
Port_.form_16_: The port cannot be empty, please enter

IP_.index_7_: Please enter the IP or remarks
IP_.index_17_: Change the IP address policy to release. After the IP address is set, normal access is restored. Do you want to continue?
IP_.index_19_: The current rule is being deleted. Do you want to continue?
IP_.index_22_: Batch delete of selected IP rules, Continue?
IP_.index_25_: Change the IP address policy to block. After the IP address is set, server access is prohibited. Do you want to continue?
IP_.form_8_: If you add an IP segment, such as: 192.168.0.0/24
IP_.form_9_: If adding a range of IPs, please enter 192.168.1.xx-192.168.1.xx
IP_.form_15_: If adding multiple IPs, please use "," to separate

Forward_.index_12_: Delete Port forward rule [Source port: {0} -> Target port: {1}]
Forward_.index_13_: Delete After a rule is selected, the source port stops forwarding the rule to the target port. Do you want to continue?
Forward_.index_16_: Batch delete of selected port forward rules, Continue?
Forward_.form_10_: If it is local port forwarding, the target IP is: 127.0.0.1
Forward_.form_11_: If the target IP is not filled in, it will be forwarded to the local port by default!
Forward_.form_12_: The port format is wrong, please fill in the number between 1 and 65535.

Area_.index_13_: Delete After a rule is selected, access to the region masked by the rule is restored. Do you want to continue?
Area_.index_16_: Batch delete of selected area rules, Continue?
Area_.form_10_: The port format is wrong, please fill in the number between 1 and 65535

SSH_.index_8_: Are you sure to turn on SSH service?
SSH_.index_9_: Turning off SSH service will also log out all logged in users, Continue?

Basic_.index_4_: Port used by the SSH protocol. The default value is 22
Basic_.index_8_: It is recommended to use a password with high complexity, please save it in time after modification, refreshing the page will clear the password box
Basic_.index_12_: You are advised to use a key to log in and disable the password for higher security
Basic_.index_17_: For more SSH security settings please use the System Hardening Module
Basic_.index_20_: Incorrect port format, available range: 1-65535, Please avoid using the following ports [80, 443, 8080, 8443, 8888]
Basic_.index_23_: After resetting the root password, the previous password will be invalid, Continue?
Basic_.index_24_: Please enable SSH key login first, then check the key
Basic_.index_25_: Please enable SSH key login first, and then download the key.

LoginAlarm_.logs_3_: Only one of the above options can be enabled simultaneously

Logs_.index_11_: After blocking this IP, this IP will no longer be allowed to access the server, Continue?
Logs_.index_12_: SSH login log page click on IP manual blocking
Logs_.index_13_: After unblocking this IP, access to the server from this IP will be restored, Continue?
Logs_.free_2_: Record and view SSH login logs

Api_.index_1_: Setting up SSH service, please wait...
Api_.index_2_: Setting up SSH key login, please wait...
Api_.index_3_: Enabling SSH key login, please wait...
Api_.index_4_: Closing SSH key login, please wait...
Api_.index_5_: Changing SSH port number, please wait...
Api_.index_6_: Setting up root login, please wait...
Api_.index_9_: Setting up login alarm, please wait...

Conf_.Index_2_: Your current IP address [{0}] is not on the whitelist
Conf_.Index_4_: It is recommended to turn on the antiviolence feature. It will better secure the server. Do you want to continue?
Conf_.Index_6_: Username-based protection tracks login attempts for user accounts. When disabled, Will not lock user accounts, but existing account locks will remain
Conf_.Index_9_: Apply protection to local addresses only
Conf_.Index_10_: Apply protection to local and remote addresses
Conf_.Index_11_: Allow username protection to lock the 'root' user
Conf_.Index_13_: IP Address-based protection tracks login attempts from specific IP addresses. When disabled, Will not block IP addresses, but existing blocks will remain
Conf_.Index_14_: IP Address-based Brute Force Protection Period (in minutes)
Conf_.Index_16_: Command to Run When an IP Address Triggers Brute Force Protection
Conf_.Index_17_: Block IP addresses at the firewall level if they trigger brute force protection
Conf_.Index_19_: Maximum Failures per IP Address before the IP Address is Blocked for One Day
Conf_.Index_20_: Command to Run When an IP Address Triggers a One-Day Block
Conf_.Index_21_: Block IP addresses at the firewall level if they trigger a one-day block
Conf_.Index_23_: Duration for Retaining Failed Logins (in minutes)
Conf_.Index_24_: Send a notification upon successful root login when the IP address is not on the whitelist
Conf_.Index_25_: Send a notification upon successful root login when the IP address is not on the whitelist, but from a known netblock
Conf_.Index_26_: Send a notification when the system detects a brute force user
Conf_.Index_27_: Please enter a number greater than 0 and not null
Conf_.Index_32_: Many common exploits require a working C compiler on the system. This tweak allows you to deny compiler access to unprivileged users; you can also choose to allow some users to use the compilers while they remain disabled by default
Conf_.Index_36_: It is recommended to turn on the Disable compiler access for non-privileged users feature. This will better secure the server. Want to continue?

WhiteList_.Index_1_: IP addresses on the whitelist can always log in to your server
WhiteList_.Index_2_: You may include an optional comment with each IP address
WhiteList_.Index_3_: Example: 169.254.1.1 # Comment for this IP address
WhiteList_.Index_4_: You can also paste in the contents of a previously downloaded whitelist

BlackList_.Index_1_: IP addresses on the blacklist can never log in to your server

History_.Index_17_: Unblocking adds the IP to the whitelist, are you sure you want to continue?
History_.Index_18_: This will remove blocks and clear reports, are you sure you want to continue?
History_.Index_19_: Blocked ip will not appear in the list when it is unblocked

Anti_.Index_4_: After turn on, the system will restrict user operation commands and record tracking
Anti_.Index_5_: When turn off the system, only record and track the commands that the user has operated
Anti_.Index_6_: At present, the default is only for intrusion problems caused by user www, redis, mysql operations
Anti_.Index_9_: The process needs to fill in the absolute path e.g: /usr/bin/curl
Anti_.Index_13_: After you delete the selected process, it will no longer receive protection. Do you want to continue?
Anti_.Index_16_: [Block IP] The blocked IP here is only for the SSH service, that is, the blocked IP will not be able to connect to SSH
Anti_.Index_17_: [Add] IP block added manually can only be unblocked manually!
Anti_.Index_20_: Please enter the correct IP address
Anti_.Index_22_: Please enter the full process name
Anti_.Index_24_: [Process name] Please fill in the complete process name, such as: mysqld
Anti_.Index_25_: [Explanation] Processes in the whitelist will no longer be detected
Anti_.Index_26_: The full path of the protected file or dir
Anti_.Index_31_: [Read-only] Files and directories cannot be modified, created, or deleted
Anti_.Index_32_: [Append] You can only add content, not delete or modify the original content
Anti_.Index_33_: [Permissions] Set the permissions of a file or directory in a protected state, and auto restore it after turn off
Anti_.Index_34_: [How to set] Please fill in the Linux Permissions code, such as: 644, 755, etc
Anti_.Index_41_: After the above strategy is triggered, the client IP will be blocked for a period of time
Anti_.Index_42_: Please check the blocking record in the panel log or operation log
Anti_.Index_43_: Please check the record of successful SSH login in the panel log or operation log

Hardening_.Index_1_: [Abnormal process] and [SSH hardening] will take up a certain amount of server overhead
Hardening_.Index_2_: After enabling the system hardening, some software installation or sensitive operations will be prohibited
Hardening_.Index_3_: After enabling [SSH hardening], if you log in to SSH for multiple consecutive login failures, the IP will be blocked
Hardening_.Index_4_: [Note] If you need to install software or plug-ins, please turn off the system hardening first!
Hardening_.Index_6_: Please turn on the main switch of System hardening first!

Compiler_.Index_2_: This group controls which users can use the system's compilers
Compiler_.Index_3_: Allow specific users to use the compilers
Compiler_.Index_6_: Are you sure to delete this user?
